Incident.Summary: Driver was observed operating motor vehicle westbound in the eastbound lanes of traffic and placed under arrest for DUI/DWI.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: THIS INCIDENT WAS CAPTURED ON L-18 IN-CAR CAMERA AND BWC #6931. DUI #23-194 TROOPER B. WHITE- ID #6931 MARYLAND STATE POLICE FORESTVILLE BARRACK L CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING: -NHTSA CERTIFIED TO CONDUCT STANDARDIZED FIELD SOBRIETY TESTS (SFST) -CERTIFIED PRELIMINARY BREATH TEST (PBT) OPERATOR -ADVANCED ROADSIDE IMPAIRED DRIVING ENFORCEMENT TRAINING (A.R.I.D.E) DESCRIPTION OF VIOLATION / INCIDENT / TRAFFIC STOP (VEHICLE IN MOTION)- On June 19, 2023, at approximately 0136 hours, I Trooper First Class White #6931, was assisting another Trooper with a vehicle collision investigation in the area of westbound Central Avenue at I-495, Prince Georges County, at which time I observed a gray Chrysler Pacifica van bearing District of Columbia registration GK7070 traveling west on Central Avenue at I-495 in the eastbound lane of travel. The gray Chrysler Pacifica returned to the westbound direction of the roadway at the intersection of Central Avenue and Brightseat Road at which time I activated my emergency equipment and initiated a traffic stop on the vehicle. INITIAL CONTACT WITH DEFENDANT (PERSONAL CONTACT)- I made contact with driver, who was identified by his District of Columbia drivers license as Sean Cornelius Carmon, DOB:07/05/1975, African American/male. While speaking to Carmon, I immediately detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from his breath and person. Carmon admitted to consuming alcoholic beverages prior to driving. While speaking with Carmon, I observed his speech to be slurred and eyes to be glassy. I informed Carmon that I would be administering standardized field sobriety tests (SFST) on him, to which he agreed to the tests. Prior to administering SFST, I advised Carmon I was going to explain the instructions to each of the tests. PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3) The evaluation was performed on the right shoulder/sidewalk of Central Avenue. The surface was dry, level, and free from any obvious debris. The weather was clear. Lighting conditions were clear due to the street lighting and surrounding business buildings lights. My patrol vehicles forward emergency lights were deactivated during all three tests. Carmon appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries. Carmon was asked the following questions: Glasses or Contacts None Medical Conditions None. Injuries None Medication None HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6 clues observed) The first test given was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test. The tip of a pen was used as the tests stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from Carmons eyes. Camron was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping his head still while following and focusing on the tip of the stimulus with his eyes until told to stop. Carmons pupils were equal in size and showed equal tracking. Carmon was positioned in a manner to ensure the headlights of passing traffic would not interfere with the test results. While administering this test, Carmon moved his head on several occasions. Carmon had to be reminded not to move his head. 1.) Lack of Smooth Pursuit Present in both eyes 2.) Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation Present in both eyes 3.) Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees Present in both eyes WALK AND TURN (5/8 clues observed). Prior to Carmon performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be conducted. I asked Carmon if he understood the test and he advised he did. Instructional stage: 1.) Lost balance- Feet broke apart and he stepped offline to the right. 2.) Started too soon- Began test prior to my instruction to began the test. Walking Stage (1st Nine): 1.) Missed heal to toe on step 4. 2.) Raised arms approximately 6 inches from his body for balance 3.) Took incorrect number of steps. Took 12 steps instead of the instructed 9 Turn: Nothing to report Walking Stage (2nd Nine): 1.) Took incorrect number of steps. Took 13 steps instead of the instructed 9 ONE LEG STAND (3/4 clues observed) Prior to Carmon performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed. Carmon was asked if he understood the test and the instructions. Carmon advised he understood. Balance and Count Stage: Seconds 0-10: Rightfoot hit the ground two (2) time. Raised arms for balance Swayed body left to right Seconds 10-20: Raised arms for balance Swayed body left to right Seconds 20-30: Rightfoot hit the ground one (1) time. Raised arms for balance Swayed body left to right While on scene, Carmon was offered a preliminary breath testand refused. ARREST Based on the following, I had probable cause to believe Carmon was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: * Traveling wrong way on the roadway * Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his body and breath * Glassy eyes * Slurred speech * My observed signs of impairment as Carmon performed field sobriety tests * Failure maintain balance * Admitted to consuming an alcoholic beverage prior to driving * Necessitating repeated instruction. Carmon was placed under arrest for Driving While Under the Influence of Alcohol. Carmon was placed in the front passenger seat per department policy and transported to the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack. Carmon was read the DR-15 Advice of Rights form in English via audioat which time herefused to take the breath test at 0204 hours. Carmonwas given all copies of pertinent paperwork and released to a valid driver. All events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.
